structure.unit: A JUSTICE AND PUBLIC SAFETY CABINET

law.catch_line: Motorcycle Safety Education Commission -- Membership -- Terms -- Meetings.

text.section: The Motorcycle Safety Education Commission is established as an independent body to help foster the growth and development of the motorcycle safety education program established under KRS 15A.350.
Members of the Motorcycle Safety Education Commission shall serve a term of four (4) years. Sitting members shall be eligible to succeed themselves.

Commission members shall receive no compensation for their services and shall not be compensated for expenses incurred from travel or in connection with the performance of their duties as commission members.
The commission shall elect its chair and vice chair from its membership.
The commission shall meet quarterly or upon the call of the chair or the request of the secretary of the Justice and Public Safety Cabinet.
The commission may take action only at meetings where a quorum is present.
The commission shall keep a record of its meetings and recommendations.

law.history: Amended 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 85, sec. 54, effective June 26, 2007. -- Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 122, sec. 7, effective July 1, 2005.
